header_summary: The email covers topics like URIs, segwit versions, timing correlation, metadata intersection, and more.The discussion involves Tony, Bastien, and Andrew Poelstra, Director of Research at Blockstream.Links for further information on URs, base64 encoding, bitcoin wallets, and UR libraries are provided.The bi-weekly specification meetings are recorded and transcribed, available at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin (AdamISZ)
recent_posts.summary:
- The email suggests that the URI version of base64 is more recommended.
- Both options double the QR density, as libraries treat them as binary data.
- UR encoding is efficient for QR codes and can be animated for large data.

recent_posts.title: segwit naming ambiguity
recent_posts.summary:
- The email discusses "is_segwit" and the labeling of segwit v0 outputs as "p2wsh" or "p2wpkh".
- However, there is no specific term for "p2wsh or p2wpkh but not p2tr".
- Andrew Poelstra, Director of Research at Blockstream, shared this information and his contact details are included.

recent_posts.title: BIP for Serverless Payjoin
recent_posts.summary:
- Timing correlation and metadata intersection in transactions are a significant concern.
- The sender has information about transaction timing and message size, which can be problematic.
- Random padding of the Payjoin PSBT message size is suggested to address this issue.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- The email recommends considering classic keysend as MPP for post-PTLCs scenario.
- CLN and LDK already support this feature and others should also adopt it.
- If recipients claim less, it is their choice and senders consider the payment sent.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Deanonymizing techniques on the LN only deanonymize the recipient, not the sender.
- Tony explains that Acinq can identify sender and destination with Phoenix and inbound payments.
- Blinded paths can help preserve sender privacy on LN, according to Bastien.

recent_posts.title: Specification Meeting Transcripts
recent_posts.summary:
- The team has been recording and transcribing bi-weekly specification meetings since January.
- The shared records can be accessed at https://btctranscripts.com/lightning-specification for others to use.
- Gurwinder from Chaincode manually checks the accuracy of the transcripts.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- Statechains implementation involves a blinded server not learning public key, signatures, or messages.
- Security in blinded statechains relies on the server reporting the number of partial signatures.
- The 2-of-2 musig2 protocol is used for key aggregation and message signing.

active_posts.title: Ark: An Alternative Privacy-preserving Second Layer Solution
active_posts.summary:
- Ark, a new second-layer protocol design, offers an alternative to the Lightning network.
- It allows users to send and receive funds without liquidity constraints.
- Ark uses virtual UTXOs, redeemed and created during payments, for off-chain, anonymous transactions.

active_posts.title: BIP-352 Silent Payments addresses should have an expiration time
active_posts.summary:
- Silent Payment addresses should have an expiration date encoded in terms of days.
- The proposed solution suggests adding a 3 byte field or using 2 bytes for expiration.
- Wallets should set a default expiration period and failed transactions should show "address expired".

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team discovered an exploit, allowing attackers to create balances through invoices.
- Exploit patched in LNbits version 0.10.5, users urged to update for security.
- Attack highlights the need for additional checks and awareness among Lightning application developers.

active_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
active_posts.summary:
- We will conduct a "dry run" of HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking.
- The plan includes collecting forwarding data, propagating an experimental TLV, and implementing reputation algorithms.
- Privacy is prioritized, and node operators are encouraged to participate in data collection.
